intro: Anychia herniariae, commonly known as the common liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its thalloid structure, which consists of a flat, leaf-like body that is typically green and covered in tiny pores. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks, soil, or decaying wood. Anychia herniariae reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its thallus. It plays a vital role in ecological systems by contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for microorganisms.
